bug.author: blublinsky
bug.summary: default-editor service account is not created while starting notebook server
bug.description:
/kind bug
After installing kubeflow 0.6 following <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/</denchmark-link> , creation of Notebook fails, because serviceaccount default-editor does not exist. Same issue is described <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/3232>#3232</denchmark-link>
Environment: OpenShift 4.1
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): 0.6 build version v1beta1 kfctl version: kfctl v0.6.0-0-g71aea0a9 Kubernetes platform: Openshift Kubernetes version: kubernetes v1.13.4+c62ce01

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/blublinsky>@blublinsky</denchmark-link> How did you create the namespace where you are trying to launch the notebook? The service accounts are created by the profile controller. You should create a profile resource to create your namespace and provision it with the appropriate service accounts. There is some documentation here. <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/other-guides/multi-user-overview/#step-2-creating-a-user-profile>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/other-guides/multi-user-overview/#step-2-creating-a-user-profile</denchmark-link>
